State of Arizona passes draconian immigration bill

The state of Arizona made the headlines last week when it signed into law a highly contentious bill intended to crackdown on illegal immigrants (Thumbnail credit Mexicans protesting against discrimination in San Francisco. Image: Matt Cohen Photo / 1115)

Belgium on the verge of banning burqas

Belgium looks poised to become the first country in Europe to ban items of clothing, include the burka and the niqab, which hides identity in public spaces. The Bill was passed easily in the lower house and may become law as early as next month (Thumbnail credit Gordon Brown is regaining ground in the polls following recent developments in the election contest. Image: Policy Network)

Vote tactically, or for what you believe in?

As election day edges closer, there is still indecision for many over which party to vote for. However, the bookies are indicating that both York Central and York Outer are not three horse races (Thumbnail credit Tactics can alter the votes filling the ballot box. Photo: Anthony Karanja)

Political Edge

Since the days of Margret Thatcher, the Tory party have been known as the 'nasty party' in British politics, and the memory of three million unemployed is still fresh in the minds of many people

The University Radio York (URY) debate with student members of the three political parties and a member of the debating society on Sunday night unfortunately, was not met with the same excitement as the recent prime ministerial debates (Thumbnail credit The stage is set for the debate with students from each of the political parties on campus. Image: University Radio York)

Much has been written about the demise of New Labour; newspapers have declared its downfall; books have been written dissecting 'what went wrong' with the New Labour project; Gordon Brown, the Labour leader, has been denounced and pronounced a deceptive dud

India to reserve one third of legislative seats for women

The Rajya Sabha, India's upper house of Parliament, has passed a bill to reserve one third of legislative seats for women (Thumbnail credit Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has endorsed the Bill [Image: World Economic Forum])

"A Generational Election"

Peter Campbell talks to Conservative Party Chairman Eric Pickles about the upcoming election. (Thumbnail credit David Cameron and Eric Pickles in the new Party Call Centre [Image: Conservative Party])

Cameron loses valuable lead in the polls

As the general election creeps ever closer, every action of the main parties is under intense scrutiny (Thumbnail credit Gordon Brown is regaining ground in the polls following recent developments in the election contest [Image: Policy Network])

Nigeria in a state of turmoil and violence

Over 200 people have been killed in violence in the Nigerian city of Jos (Thumbnail credit Nigerian police have been struggling to keep control [Image: Satanoid])
